President of Sierra Leone Supports Reunification of Korea
articles.content:
President of Sierra Leone Supports Reunification of Korea 
    Pyongyang, April 20 (KCNA) -- The government of Sierra Leone is following the contacts between the north and south for national reunification and wishes to see the strenuous efforts of the Korean people bearing fruits. It hopes that the nuclear issue of the Korean Peninsula will be peacefully resolved. Al Haji Ahmad Tejan Kabbah, president of Sierra Leone, said this when receiving credentials from DPRK Ambassador to that country Kim Pong Hui on April 7.
 Sierra Leone stands for peaceful solutions to all disputes and international issues, he noted.

Functions Held in Cuba
articles.content:
Functions Held in Cuba 
    Pyongyang, April 20 (KCNA) -- Functions of laying floral baskets before portraits of President Kim Il Sung were held by the Organization of Solidarity of the Peoples of Africa, Asia and Latin America (OSPAALA) and at Kim Il Sung Economic Special School on April 13 and 14 on the occasion of the Day of the Sun.
 Present there were a secretary of the OSPAALA, Juan Jose Leon Vega, chairman of the Cuban Committee for Supporting Korea's Reunification, and Rolando Fernandez, principal of Kim Il Sung Economic Special School, and its teaching staff, the ambassador and staff members of the DPRK embassy in Havana.    
 The participants laid floral baskets before the portraits of  Kim Il Sung and paid tribute to him.

articles.title: End to U.S. Colonial Rule over S. Korea Called for
articles.content:
End to U.S. Colonial Rule over S. Korea Called for 
    Pyongyang, April 20 (KCNA) -- A spokesman for the Anti-Imperialist National Democratic Front in a statement Tuesday on the occasion of the 45th anniversary of the April 19 Popular Uprising called for intensifying the struggle against the U.S. and war and for the withdrawal of the U.S. forces under the uplifted banner of three forms of cooperation for national independence, peace against war and reunification and patriotism with the same spirit and courage as displayed by the participants in the April 19 Popular Uprising, according to Kuguk Jonson Internet site.
 What the martyrs of the uprising so ardently desired has not yet come true, the statement noted, adding that the reality urgently calls on the south Korean people to carry forward their spirit and drive the U.S. imperialist aggression forces, the root cause of all sorts of misfortune and pain of the nation, out of south Korea, and put an end to the 60 year-long disgraceful history of their colony.
 All the people should turn out in the struggle to terminate the U.S. colonial rule over south Korea in a do-or-die spirit under the slogan "Let's not allow the U.S. forces' presence in south Korea to go beyond 60 years," the statement urged.

U.S. War Plan against North Flailed in S. Korea
articles.content:
U.S. War Plan against North Flailed in S. Korea
    Pyongyang, April 20 (KCNA) -- The South Headquarters of the National Alliance of Youth and Students for the Country's Reunification in a statement on April 16 reportedly urged the U.S. to clearly see the strength of the great unity of the Korean nation and promptly retract the "OPLAN 5029-05," a harebrained plan for a war against the north.
 Recalling that the U.S. had of late drawn up the "OPLAN 5029-05,�h the keynote of which is to induce a war in the Korean Peninsula, the statement said the current situation requires an unequivocal realization of south-north cooperation for national independence, cooperation for peace against war and cooperation for reunification and patriotism.    
 Our youth and students will wage a death-defying struggle to the end as the vanguard of national cooperation under the uplifted banner of peace against the U.S. and war and the withdrawal of the U.S. forces, stressed the statement.

U.S. War Plan Slammed
articles.content:
U.S. War Plan Slammed
    Pyongyang, April 20 (KCNA) -- The United States and the south Korean bellicose forces recently drew up the "OPLAN 5029-05". It is a war scenario more adventurous and provocative than any of the previous ones they had constantly supplemented and rounded off for a preemptive attack on the DPRK, says Minju Joson in a commentary today.
 The keynote of the newly drafted "OPLAN 5029-05," the news analyst goes on, is that the U.S. and south Korea should play the main role in openly inducing a war on the Korean Peninsula. Herein lies the grave nature of this war scenario against the DPRK.
 According to it, the south Korea-U.S. "combined forces command" will undertake all actions from working out detailed plans to carrying out operations. Under the previous plans, the U.S. Pacific Command was to mainly take charge of military operations and actions. So, the "OPLAN 5029-05" is an adventurous scenario aimed at the provocation of a Korean war by the "combined forces command" any time, and it is a very dangerous document allowing a preemptive attack on the DPRK in a short time.    
 The plan has made it all the clearer that the U.S. harbors in actuality the sinister intention to stifle the idea and system of the DPRK, though it makes free with the phrases of "peaceful solution to the nuclear issue" and "resumption of the six-way talks". Now that the U.S. seeks to contain the DPRK by force, the army and people of the latter have no alternative but to put up a total rebuff.

articles.title: Three Generals of Mt. Paektu Registered as Honorary Citizens in Ecuador
articles.content:
Three Generals of Mt. Paektu Registered as Honorary Citizens in Ecuador
    Pyongyang, April 20 (KCNA) -- An extraordinary plenary meeting of the Loja City Government of Ecuador on April 15 decided to register President Kim Il
Sung, leader Kim Jong Il and anti-Japanese war hero Kim Jong Suk, three generals of Mt. Paektu, as honorary citizens and present the key to the city to Kim Jong Il on the occasion of the Day of the Sun and the 60th anniversaries of the Workers' Party of Korea and Korea's liberation.
 The mayor of the city made a speech and the chief of protocol of the city introduced the diploma of honorary citizenship at the meeting.    
 Written in the diploma is a decision that the Loja City Government Council registers the three generals of Mt. Paektu as honorary citizens of the city and presents the key to the city to Marshal Kim Jong Il.
